intro: Diplocyclos palmatus, commonly known as the African mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its rough, often branched stem. The plant produces showy, palmately lobed leaves and vibrant yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the Malvaceae family.
